Package com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.pinpoint.targeting.notification

Class NotificationClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazonaws.mobileconnectors.pinpoint.targeting.notification.NotificationClient
  • public class NotificationClient
extends java.lang.Object
    NotificationClient is the entry point into the Amazon Mobile Analytics SDK to handle Pinpoint notifications.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description

      Result values of handling a Pinpoint push message.

    • Method Detail

      • createClient

        public static NotificationClient createClient​(PinpointContext pinpointContext,
                                              ChannelType channelType)
        Creates a new NotificationClient based on the supplied context and channel type. This method returns an instance based on NotificationClient interface.
        Parameters:
        pinpointContext - Context to associate with the client.
        channelType - The channel type the client will support.
        Returns:
        A new instance of the NotificationClient

      • registerGCMDeviceToken

        @Deprecated
public void registerGCMDeviceToken​(java.lang.String deviceToken)
        Deprecated.
        Use registerDeviceToken(String) instead.
        This method should be called once the device token has been received from the GCM api in order to enable being targeted for campaign push notifications.
        Parameters:

      • handleFCMCampaignPush

        @Deprecated
public NotificationClient.CampaignPushResult handleFCMCampaignPush​(java.lang.String from,
                                                                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> data)
        Deprecated.
        Use handleCampaignPush(NotificationDetails) instead.
        Handles Pinpoint FCM push messages by posting a local notification when the app is in the background, or sending a local broadcast if the app is in the foreground. Also on Api level 19 devices and above, if local notifications have been disabled and the app is in the background, a local broadcast is sent.
        Parameters:
        from - the from string received by the FCM service,
        data - the bundle received from the FCM service
        Returns:
        NotificationClient.PushResult.

      • handleGCMCampaignPush

        @Deprecated
public NotificationClient.CampaignPushResult handleGCMCampaignPush​(java.lang.String from,
                                                                   android.os.Bundle data,
                                                                   java.lang.Class<? extends android.app.Service> serviceClass)
        Deprecated.
        Use handleCampaignPush(NotificationDetails) instead.
        Handles Pinpoint GCM push messages by posting a local notification when the app is in the background, or sending a local broadcast if the app is in the foreground. Also on Api level 19 devices and above, if local notifications have been disabled and the app is in the background, a local broadcast is sent.
        Parameters:
        from - the from string received by the GCM service
        data - the bundle received from the GCM service
        serviceClass - the class extending GCMListenerService that handles receiving GCM messages.
        Returns:
        NotificationClient.PushResult.

      • areAppNotificationsEnabled

        public boolean areAppNotificationsEnabled()
        If app-level opt-out is enabled, this method always returns false. Otherwise, the following logic applies: On devices using Android API level 19 and above, this method properly returns whether local notifications are enabled for the app. For devices before API level 19, this method always returns true. Disabling notifications was a feature added on devices supporting API Level 16 and above, so devices from API level 16 to 18 will return true from this method even when local notifications have been disabled for the app.
        Returns:
        true if local notifications are enabled for this app, otherwise false.

      • addDeviceTokenRegisteredHandler

        public final void addDeviceTokenRegisteredHandler​(DeviceTokenRegisteredHandler handler)
        Add a device token register handler.
        Parameters:

        Remove the device register handler.
        Parameters:

      • registerDeviceToken

        public final void registerDeviceToken​(java.lang.String deviceToken)
        This method should be called once the device token has been received from the device's messaging api in order to enable being targeted for campaign push notifications.
        Parameters:
        deviceToken - the device token.

      • registerDeviceToken

        public final void registerDeviceToken​(java.lang.String userId,
                                      java.lang.String channelId)
        This method should be called once the user id and channel id has been received from the device's messaging api in order to enable being targeted for campaign push notifications.
        Parameters:
        userId - the user id
        channelId - the channel id

      • getDeviceToken

        public final java.lang.String getDeviceToken()
        get the device token.
        Returns:
        the device token.

      • getChannelType

        public java.lang.String getChannelType()
        The Pinpoint channel type for the device associated with this notification client.
        Returns:
        Channel type for the device.

      • handleNotificationReceived

        public NotificationClient.PushResult handleNotificationReceived​(NotificationDetails notificationDetails)
        Handles Pinpoint push messages by posting a local notification when the app is in the background, or sending a local broadcast if the app is in the foreground. Also on Api level 19 devices and above, if local notifications have been disabled and the app is in the background, a local broadcast is sent.
        Parameters:
        notificationDetails - the notification message received by the device's messaging service
        Returns:
        NotificationClient.PushResult.

public NotificationClient.CampaignPushResult handleCampaignPush​(NotificationDetails notificationDetails)

        see handleNotificationReceived(NotificationDetails)
